prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a slightly tapered top for the rectangular prism. 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with no rotation and a translation vector of [0, 0, 0]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create a rectangle by drawing four lines as follows: - Line 1: Starting at [0, 0], ending at [0.75, 0] - Line 2: Starting at [0.75, 0], ending at [0.75, 0.1957] - Line 3: Starting at [0.75, 0.1957], ending at [0, 0.1957] - Line 4: Starting at [0, 0.1957], ending at [0, 0] 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: [0, 0, 0] - Translation Vector: [0, 0, 0] 6. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.2935 units in the positive normal direction. 7. Perform a NewBodyFeatureOperation to complete this part. Part 2: Construct the main body of the rectangular prism. 1. Create a new coordinate system with a rotation of [0, 0, -90] degrees and a translation vector of [0.013, 0, 0.013]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Create a rectangle by drawing four lines as follows: - Line 1: Starting at [0, 0], ending at [0.7239, 0] - Line 2: Starting at [0.7239, 0], ending at [0.7239, 0.2674] - Line 3: Starting at [0.7239, 0.2674], ending at [0, 0.2674] - Line 4: Starting at [0, 0.2674], ending at [0, 0] 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.7239. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: [0, 0, 0] - Translation Vector: [0, 0, 0] 6. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.0082 units in the negative normal direction. 7. Perform a CutFeatureOperation to subtract this volume from the earlier part.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Curved Rectangular Prism** **1.1 Create the Coordinate System** The first step is to create a new coordinate system. The Euler angles should be set to 0 degrees for all three axes ([0.0, 0.0, 0.0]) and the translation vector should also be set to 0 ([0.0, 0.0, 0.0]). This will create a default coordinate system, centered at the origin. **1.2 Draw the Sketch** Next, we will draw the 2D sketch for the first part. This sketch will be drawn on the XY plane of the coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face (face_1), which is bounded by a single loop (loop_1). This loop consists of 8 line segments, which are listed as line_1 through line_8. - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.375] - line_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.375], End Point [0.5625, 0.375] - line_4: Start Point [0.5625, 0.375], End Point [0.4687, 0.75] - line_5: Start Point [0.4687, 0.75], End Point [0.2812, 0.75] - line_6: Start Point [0.2812, 0.75], End Point [0.1875, 0.375] - line_7: Start Point [0.1875, 0.375], End Point [0.0, 0.375] - line_8: Start Point [0.0, 0.375], End Point [0.0, 0.0] **1.3 Scale the Sketch** The next step is to scale the 2D sketch. The scaling parameter is 0.75. **1.4 Transform the Sketch into 3D** Now, we will transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch. We will use the coordinate system's euler angles and translation vector for this transformation. **1.5 Extrude the Sketch** Finally, we will extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. The extrusion depth towards the normal is 0.1125 and the extrusion depth opposite the normal is 0.0. The sketch scale is also 0.75. The operation is a "New Body Feature Operation", which means this part will be a new solid body. After completing these steps, the first part will be a curved rectangular prism. The length and width of this part are both 0.75 units and the height is 0.1125 units. This part will be the base for the next parts, which will be built upon it.</description>
